item.title: Jeanne add a quote by J.R. Moehringer
item.description: "Of course many bars in Manhasset, like bars everywhere, were nasty places, full of pickled people marinating in regret." -- J.R. Moehringer

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I was born lost and take no pleasure in being found." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "For it is my opinion that we enclose and celebrate the freaks of our nation and our civilization. Yellowstone National Park is no more representative of America than is Disneyland." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a cross of iron." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower
